title: Calories in Hot Chocolate
meta_description: Discover calories in hot chocolate per cup, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and easy tweaks for different preparations.
assumptions: 1 cup (240 ml) prepared from cocoa mix with whole milk, no added sugar or toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by milk type, cocoa brand, added sweeteners, and serving size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One cup of hot chocolate made with whole milk has about 190 kcal and 8 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use skim milk instead of whole

faqs.q: How many calories in one cup of hot chocolate?
faqs.a: About 190 kcal for a standard cup made with whole milk.

faqs.q: Is hot chocolate high in sugar?
faqs.a: Yes, typically 22 g sugars per cup from milk and cocoa mix.

faqs.q: What's the protein in hot chocolate?
faqs.a: Around 8 g per cup, mostly from the milk.

faqs.q: How does milk type affect calories in hot chocolate?
faqs.a: Whole milk adds more fat and calories; skim reduces by ~50 kcal per cup.

faqs.q: Are there low-calorie hot chocolate options?
faqs.a: Yes, use diet mix with water or almond milk for under 100 kcal.
